bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alfred Danziger, January 8, 1942

div1.p: Hench congratulates the Danzigers on their marriage.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alfred Danziger, January 8, 1942
div1.opener:
Alfred Danziger
Ms Slady Moore (Danziger)
January 8, 1942
Dear Folks:
div1.p:
Mary and I were indeed surprised (although Mary said)
she wasn't surprised at all; you know, a woman's intuition)
to receive the genial New Year's card and the announcement
that you are now Mr. and Mrs. Mary and I have often said
that we had never met two more charming people and our brief
but exceedingly pleasant meeting in New Orleans will be long
remembered. We certainly wish you every possible happiness
and success in the coming years and hope that we can renew
our acquaintance in the not too distant future, either at
New Orleans or, preferably, this time at Rochester, should
you happen to come for other than medical purposes.

I am off today to Washington to a medical meeting
but hope to ramble around some of the old governmental
archives to amplify my story on the conquest of yellow
fever. Let me say again how much I appreciated the refer-
ences which you had sent to me from New Orleans.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Danziger
#24 Allard Blvd.
New Orleans, La.
